page.title: 20Local News
page.content: Residents receive their news in several ways. A chat over the counter of the village stores, or the bar of one of the pubs; the Parish Magazine reaches most homes with its news of church matters and local societies; the Sussex Express and the Courier are the local newspapers and Radio Sussex is the local radio station. A newsworthy item in recent months has been the Village Bypass, which it is hoped will be built from Park Corner to Halland crossroads. This will leave East Hoathly free of through traffic on the A22 and should improve village life. Three routes were shown to the public and a questionnaire was distributed to all houses in the vacinity. The "Blue Route" which is the longest, was chosen as the most suitable. A bypass was first discussed in 1931.
